## Case #1

![](_extensions/uaz/Underline.png)

#### Question: Do dogs and cats love us differently?

![](_extensions/uaz/MilesCat.png)

#### What do we know?

N = 20 dogs, 20 cats

Comparing Oxytocin - % increase

------------------------------------------------------------------------

## Case #1

![](_extensions/uaz/Underline.png)

#### Question: Do dogs and cats love us differently?

::: columns
::: column
![](_extensions/uaz/MilesCatCol1.png)
:::

::: column
```{r echo = FALSE}
pacman::p_load(
  ggthemes, 
               ggpubr, 
               tidyverse)

theme_set(theme_pubr(base_size = 32))
theme_update(axis.text.x = element_text(family = "Helvetica"),
             axis.text.y = element_blank(),
             axis.title.x = element_blank(),
             axis.title.y = element_text(family = "Helvetica"),
             axis.ticks = element_blank(),
             legend.position = "none")

Group <- c("Dogs", "Cats")

Data <- c(65, 25)

df <- as.data.frame(cbind(Group, Data))

df |>
ggplot(aes(x = Group, y = Data, fill = Group)) +
  geom_col(width = 0.33) +
  ylab("Oxytocin increase (%)") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("#0072B2", "#D55E00"))
  
```
:::
:::

#### What do we know?

N = 20 dogs, 20 cats

Comparing Oxytocin - % increase

## Case #2

![](_extensions/uaz/Underline.png)

#### Question: Do dogs and cats love us differently?

::: columns
::: column
![](_extensions/uaz/MilesCatCol2.png)
:::

::: column
```{r echo = FALSE}
pacman::p_load(
  ggthemes, 
               ggpubr, 
               tidyverse)

theme_set(theme_pubr(base_size = 32))
theme_update(axis.text.x = element_text(family = "Helvetica"),
             axis.text.y = element_blank(),
             axis.title.x = element_blank(),
             axis.title.y = element_text(family = "Helvetica"),
             axis.ticks = element_blank(),
             legend.position = "none")
Group1 <- c("Dogs", "Cats")

Data1 <- c(75, 10)

df1 <- as.data.frame(cbind(Group1, Data1))

df1 |>
ggplot(aes(x = fct_rev(Group1), y = Data1, fill = fct_rev(Group1))) +
  geom_col(width = 0.33) +
  ylab("% that chose each") +
  scale_fill_manual(values = c("#D55E00", "#0072B2"))
  
```
:::
:::

#### What do we know?

N = 20 dog and 20 cat owners

Ask which loves the owner more: dog or cat

Comparing % that say dog or cat
